WhatIsCCUS.title: What is CCUS?
WhatIsCCUS.subtitle: Key Technology for Carbon Neutrality
WhatIsCCUS.description: CCUS is a technology that captures carbon dioxide emitted from industrial facilities and power plants, then utilizes or safely stores it.
WhatIsCCUS.capture_description: Technology to separate and capture CO₂ from emission sources using various methods such as amine scrubbing and oxy-fuel combustion.
WhatIsCCUS.utilization_description: Converting captured CO₂ into useful products such as fuels, chemicals, and building materials.
WhatIsCCUS.storage_description: Long-term storage of captured CO₂ in geologically stable formations to prevent atmospheric release.

TechnologyProcess.title: CCUS Technology Process
TechnologyProcess.subtitle: Achieving Carbon Neutrality with Integrated Systems
TechnologyProcess.app1_description: Efficiently capturing large amounts of CO₂ from coal and gas-fired power generation.
TechnologyProcess.app2_description: Applied to carbon-intensive industries such as cement, steel, and petrochemicals.
TechnologyProcess.app3_description: Capturing CO₂ from biogas production to produce pure methane.
